[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Historical Block Manipulation] Can oldest_block_height be manipulated to cause clients to incorrectly query for block information that has been pruned? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Block Height Jump] Can sudden increases in oldest_block_height cause clients to miss important block events or state transitions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Cursor Injection] Can a malicious API server inject arbitrary strings into the cursor field that cause SQL injection, command injection, or path traversal when used by the client? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Cursor Size DoS] Is there any limit on cursor string length, or can an API server provide extremely large cursor values (e.g., gigabytes) causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Cursor Format Validation] Does the code validate cursor format, or can arbitrary strings be accepted that break pagination logic or cause parser errors downstream? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Cursor Spoofing] Can an attacker manipulate the cursor value to cause clients to skip data, replay data, or access unauthorized pagination ranges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Struct: State] [Cursor None Handling] Is the Option<String> for cursor properly handled in all downstream code, or can None values cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Header Injection] Can HTTP header injection attacks insert newlines or special characters into header values that bypass parsing and inject malicious state values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [UTF-8 Validation] Does HeaderValue::to_str() properly handle non-UTF-8 header values, or can binary data injection cause parsing failures or security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Header Case Sensitivity] Are header names case-sensitive in the lookup, or can an attacker bypass validation by using different case variations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Duplicate Headers] Does the code handle duplicate headers correctly (e.g., multiple X-Aptos-Chain-Id headers), or will only the first/last be used, enabling header confusion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Header Whitespace] Are leading/trailing whitespaces in header values properly trimmed before parsing, or can '  42  ' bypass validation that expects '42'? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Partial Parsing Attack] Can an attacker provide headers that parse successfully for some fields but not others, causing the error path to leak information about valid/invalid values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Error Message Information Leak] Does the error message at lines 87-98 leak sensitive information about expected state values that could help an attacker craft valid-looking fake state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Missing Header Attack] Can an attacker omit specific headers to trigger the error path and cause denial of service or bypass state validation checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Parse Error Recovery] Are parsing errors properly propagated, or can silent failures cause the client to use uninitialized or default state values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Struct: State] [State Invariant] Are there any invariants (e.g., version >= oldest_ledger_version, block_height >= oldest_block_height) that should be validated but aren't? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Cross-Field Validation] Is there validation for relationships between fields (epoch/version, timestamp/version, block_height/version), or can inconsistent state be created? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Struct: State] [State Mutation] Is State properly immutable after creation, or can fields be modified leading to inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Atomic State Creation] Is State creation atomic, or can race conditions during construction cause partially initialized State objects? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Negative Integer Parsing] Can negative numbers in header strings be parsed as large positive u64 values due to wrapping, causing version/timestamp/epoch manipulation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Leading Zero Handling] Are leading zeros in numeric strings handled correctly (e.g., '00042'), or can they cause parsing inconsistencies? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Hexadecimal Injection] Can attacker inject hexadecimal strings (e.g., '0x42') that get parsed differently than expected decimal values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Function: from_headers()] [Scientific Notation] Are scientific notation strings (e.g., '1e10') rejected or can they be parsed causing unexpected large values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/state.rs] [Struct: State] [Integer Type Limits] Does using u8 for chain_id (max 255) create limitations or security issues if Aptos expands to more than 255 chains? (Low)
